alert.note: Alert for Brown; McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:01PM CDT until June 17 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BROWN...SOUTHEASTERN COLEMAN...NORTHEASTERN MCCULLOCH AND NORTHWESTERN SAN SABA COUNTIES... At 601 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Shields, or near Rockwood, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Bangs and Rockwood around 610 PM CDT. Trickham around 615 PM CDT. Brownwood around 635 PM CDT. Brookesmith around 640 PM CDT. Winchell and Camp Bowie around 645 PM CDT. Mercury around 655 PM CDT. Elm Grove around 700 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Mozelle, Whon, Us-283 Near The Mcculloch- Coleman County Line, Milburn, Indian Creek and Shields. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
